ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńtyé ngʉ̀ŋe letʉŋ Jÿenézalɛd. Anùɔ láʼ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé léjúʼu nò Ssé.
en: As the crowd was pressing in on Jesus to hear God’s word,   he was standing by Lake Gennesaret.  # 5:1 Another name for the Sea of Galilee,# 5:1 Nm 34:11; Dt 3:17; Jos 12:3; 13:27; Mt 4:18

ngiemboon: Yěsô maʼ nÿɔ́g, ńgyá kanúʼ sépʉ́a ngʉ̀ŋe ntse, mbà pamaʼ ssó ně fó tsoló ńkẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ ntse sɔgɔ mekÿo mɔ́b.
en: He saw two boats at the edge of the lake; the fishermen had left them and were washing their nets.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́, á gwɔ́ ye Símò, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à náʼa ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ ntse. Á zẅíŋ, Yěsô sẅɛ́ʼ ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ, ńzye lélaʼte nò Ssé mbwó láʼ.
en: He got into one of the boats,   which belonged to Simon, and asked him to put out a little from the land. Then he sat down and was teaching the crowds from the boat.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, ńtsẅi né Símò ngie: «Lɔgɔ kanúʼ, ńgíŋ ńgʉa tà ńkúu na jʉʼʉ ntse gie á meʼe ssé, ḿmaʼ mekÿo mí ntse lélɔg ńgwoon messó.»
en: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into deep water and let down your nets for a catch.”

ngiemboon: Símò tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Andè, peg lǎʼ pɔ́ légyá ngɔ́ʼ, ḿmwoon ntse, ńké te tsɔ́ lagá mmó gwoon. Táʼ, páʼ kwàʼ gù zɔ gɔ̌ɔn ngie mé gíŋ ḿmaʼ mekÿo ntse lɛ̂, n ge maʼ.»
en: “Master,”   Simon replied, “we’ve worked hard all night long and caught nothing. But if you say so, I’ll let down the nets.”  # 5:5 Other mss read net (Gk sg)

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, pâ pʉ̀a pé gʉa ḿmaʼ mekÿo tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńdɔg ńgwoon messó é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn tà pɔ́ ne shwoŋo, mekÿo mɔ́b zye lézáʼte.
en: When they did this, they caught a great number of fish, and their nets   began to tear.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá kékáŋ, ḿmaʼte pwó ńdɔg ńtóŋ yetsɔ́ ngàŋa nkwò yɔ́b gie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ yetsɔ́ kanú, ngie pɔ́ tó ńnéŋ mbwó, pɔ́ tó, pâ pɔ̌ pú ńnéŋ messó tsɛ̀ɛ mekanúʼ mémbʉ́a, mekanúʼ ŋwɛ́ lúe tà ńcʉ́ʼʉ ḿmeʼe pɔ́ ntse.
en: So they signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them; they came and filled both boats so full that they began to sink.

ngiemboon: Símò Piɛ gyá yɔɔn nò gyǎ, tà ńgʉa ńnuŋe mekwò Yěsô, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, tsetsɔ́ʼ, fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńgʉa, n gee páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ tepòŋ mvfò Ssé.»
en: When Simon Peter saw this, he fell at Jesus’s knees and said, “Go away from me, because I’m a sinful man, Lord! ”

ngiemboon: À la gwaa gɔɔn púʼu, mbà cÿɔʼ pǔ ńgwoon yé lâ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ la gwɔ́, ńtí nzẅìŋ messó mie pɔ́ gwǒon.
en: For he and all those with him were amazed   at the catch of fish they had taken,

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ Jÿâŋ pɔ́ Jÿâg, é gubé Zebende, gie é laa ngàŋa yetsɔ́ kanúʼ la gíŋ ḿbú ḿbɔ́g yɔ́b tɛʼ. Táʼ, Yěsô gɔɔn né Símò ngie: «Te pɔ́g pɔ̌g, tà fó lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, ɔ̀ ge nyé légwoon messó, é cʉ́ʼʉ cúʼte pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.»
en: and so were James and John, Zebedee’s sons, who were Simon’s partners.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼ púʼu, ńdɔg mekanúʼ ḿbiŋ né ngʉ̀ŋe ntse, ńkúu wó, ḿbú ńnyé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô.
en: Then they brought the boats to land, left everything, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó, mbà nkàʼ pǎb leen ḿbú ńjÿó yé. Á gyá Yěsô, ńdeen ńtó ńnuŋe mekwò yé, ésẅíŋte yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n zsě ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńkwoŋ, mbà ɔ̀ kuʼu légÿo n zeŋe.»
en: While he was in one of the towns, a man was there who had leprosy   all over him.  # 5:12–14 Mt 8:2–4; Mk 1:40–44 He saw Jesus, fell facedown, and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô júʼ, ńtsege pwó, ńkíbe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n kwǒŋ púʼu, zeŋe.» Nkàʼ pǎb gwoon ḿmaga na yé.
en: Reaching out his hand, Jesus touched him,   saying, “I am willing; be made clean,” and immediately the leprosy left him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tɔʼɔ yé ngie: «Pɔ́ɔn lékím tà shwóŋo nyìŋ, gʉa ńnyɛ pɔ́ mbùm jù mbwó nùŋepwɔʼ, ḿbiŋ ńnáa mmó gie lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê ne ńzɛ́te mbwó nyìŋ gẅie nkàʼ pǎb magá na yé, pʉ̀a metsèm leen ńké ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ zeŋé.»
en: Then he ordered him to tell no one:   “But go and show yourself to the priest, and offer what Moses commanded for your cleansing as a testimony to them.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô la tɔʼɔ yé púʼu, mé ké ne ńkẅiʼi ńkíme yé kǐm, tà láʼ gíŋe ńkẅiʼi ńtóo léjúʼu shwóŋè yé mbɔɔ légwɔ́ gie à ge zeŋe meguɔ mɔ́b.
en: But the news   about him spread even more, and large crowds would come together to hear him and to be healed of their sicknesses.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yěsô néŋe tà ńdu ssé ńgee jʉʼ gie nyìŋ te wó wɔ́, ésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: Yet he often withdrew to deserted places and prayed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńne ńzíʼi pʉ̀a mmó, epʉ̀a Falísáyè pâ pakyagte mbʉ̌ Ssé tó ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ yé, é fóo na meláʼ mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa mbɔɔ ye Yúndà tà mbɔɔ tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm. Metʉ̀ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gwɔ́ na Yěsô, á lɔgɔ ńzeŋe meguɔ.
en: On one of those days while he was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law   were sitting there who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea, and also from Jerusalem. And the Lord’s power to heal was in him.  # 5:17 Mk 5:30; Lk 6:19; 8:46

ngiemboon: Mé néŋe tà ńgyá mbàŋa lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie kwʉ́ʼte aa na yé, ńtó, mbà pɔ́ lɔgɔ́ páŋte ńkaa yé, éfaʼ nzsè lékúu ndá ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé mvfò Yěsô.
en: Just then some men came,   carrying on a stretcher a man who was paralyzed. They tried to bring him in and set him down before him.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ sẅɛ́ɛ ncwò ndá sẅɛ̌ tà pɔ́ gyá kékáŋ, ńcʉ́ʼ ńdɔgɔ yé ḿpfó pɔ́ nzsè gie e gee lé ntsɔ̀ʼ ndá, ńkúu wó, ńtsɔ́ʼte mmó gie mé la lɔg sẅe ndá, éfó jʉʼó ésẅíʼi nguɔ tsɛ̀ɛ páŋte we, ńnuŋe mvfò Yěsô.
en: Since they could not find a way to bring him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and lowered him on the stretcher through the roof tiles into the middle of the crowd before Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá ntí gie mbàŋa ŋwɛ́ lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m na yé, ńgɔɔn né nguɔ ngie: «Ashǔ wɔ̀ɔn, mé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwó gù.»
en: Seeing their faith he said, “Friend,    your sins are forgiven.”

ngiemboon: pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê lâ pafalísáyè júʼ, ńzye lézẅɛ́te ngie: «Wɔɔn aa wɔ̌ gẅie à zoonte Ssé? E Ssé gíle yé zɔ kuʼu lélege menò tepòŋ nyìŋ.»
en: Then the scribes and the Pharisees   began to think to themselves, “Who is this man who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone? ”  # 5:21 Is 43:25

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ zẅɛ́te mǒ, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi gǎa ńgẅiin yɛ̂ ntí nkwaŋá?
en: But perceiving their thoughts, Jesus replied to them, “Why are you thinking this in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi gyǎ gí ngie á zéŋe pɔ́ légɔɔn né nyìŋ ngie “mé legé menò tepòŋ mú” kà pɔ́ légɔɔn ngie “lu ssé ńgiŋ?”
en: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ púʼu, n ge ké nyɛɛ gẅí ngie áa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, mbà mé la ná metʉ̀ né Míŋ Nyìŋ lélɔg ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b.» Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né nguɔ ngie: «Lu ssé, ńkaa páŋte gù ńdɔg ńgʉa lé mbʉ̀a gù!»
en: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”  #— #he told the paralyzed man, “I tell you: Get up, take your stretcher, and go home.”

ngiemboon: Á gwóon ńdu ssé tsetsɛ̀ɛ láʼ, ńkaa páŋte, ńdeen ńké ńgwaa piŋ lé mbʉ̀a yé, ńgiŋe ńguʼte Ssé.
en: Immediately he got up before them, picked up what he had been lying on, and went home glorifying God.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm la gyá á kʉʼʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ ne ḿbɔ́gɔ, ńgíŋe ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Agùʼte áa mbwó Ssé, peg gyǎ ndàagyá lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.»
en: Then everyone was astounded, and they were giving glory to God. And they were filled with awe   and said, “We have seen incredible things today.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńkẅɛ ńne ńgee, ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Lěvî, á gwɔ́ nkẅè ncùb pà Loma, ńnéŋe jʉʼ gie mé kẅé ncùb pà Loma wó. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, pɔ̀gɔ zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńgiŋe!»
en: After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax office,   and he said to him, “Follow me.”

ngiemboon: Lěvî nyé shúm ntsèm, ńdu ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: So, leaving everything behind, he got up and began to follow him.

ngiemboon: Lěvî gÿo ńtóŋo máamáa línɔ̀ɔn ndá yé ńtí Yěsô. Pakẅé ncùb, tà mbɔɔ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, é tó tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, pâ Yěsô pú ne ńteme ńjÿó shúm.
en: Then Levi hosted a grand banquet for him at his house. Now there was a large crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining at the table with them.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pafalísáyè lâ tsɔ́ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê gyá púʼu, ńne ńzẅɛ́te, ńzɛ́te megàŋakwò Yěsô ngie: «Mélàʼakɔ́ pi lâ pà kẅé ncùb lâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ teme shúm ḿpfɛ́ɛ?»
en: But the Pharisees and their scribes   were complaining to his disciples, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô saga mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le gwɔ́ ntentʉ́ ńgʉa faʼa ngÿòmeffo wɔ́. Nyìŋ guɔ tá faʼa yé.
en: Jesus replied to them, “It is not those who are healthy who need a doctor, but those who are sick.

ngiemboon: N ka te tó pɔ́ létóŋ pʉ̀a pie é kwaŋ ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a membòŋo ngie pɔ́ piŋe mbwó Ssé wɔ́. N ka tǒ ńtí pɔ́ megàŋ mefʉa.»
en: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

ngiemboon: Pafalísáyè gíŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó Yěsô ngie: «Megàŋakwò Jÿâŋ, é néŋe ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé. Epég pʉ̀a gíŋ ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ púʼu. Táʼ, epú ké te púʼu gÿo. Pɔ́ zsé pɔ́ lépfɛ́ɛ mmó ḿbiŋ ńnú melùʼ.»
en: Then they said to him, “John’s disciples fast often and say prayers, and those of the Pharisees do the same, but yours eat and drink.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gʉa leluŋó nyìŋ, á nyé ńnéŋe néŋe, meshǔ pé pie mé ně ńtóŋ, é néŋe nzyè lêkɔ́?
en: Jesus said to them, “You can’t make the wedding guests fast while the groom is with them, can you?

ngiemboon: Táʼ, mé ge láʼ fó mbwó pɔ́b tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ésaʼa yé, pɔ́ leen ńké ńnéŋe nzyè fʉʼó ŋwɛ́.»
en: But the time    will come   # 5:35 1Sm 2:31; Ps 37:13; Ec 2:16; 12:1; Lk 17:22 when the groom will be taken away from them #— #then they will fast in those days.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ sag ngie: «À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le záʼa mmó nzsǒ na nzsǒ sẅé ńdɔg ńtsɛ́ lepÿé na nzẅìŋe nzsǒ wɔ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, á lɔg ńcʉŋte nzsǒ sẅé, ammó nzsǒ sẅé gie à zǎʼ, à ké le pumo na nzẅìŋe nzsǒ wɔ́.
en: He also told them a parable: “No one tears a patch from a new garment and puts it on an old garment. Otherwise, not only will he tear the new, but also the piece from the new garment will not match the old.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ne ńgee ńdeʼe melùʼ tsɛ̀ɛ ntúʼ ngùb, mbà mé té néŋ melùʼ mie mé nyé ńtsɔ́ʼɔ, á tsɛ̀ɛ nzẅìŋe ntúʼ wɔ́. Mé lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, mbà melùʼ sẅé ge fuʼ, éshʉ́a nzẅìŋe ntúʼ. Mé sɔ́ɔn melùʼ, ésɔ́ɔn ntúʼ.
en: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the new wine will burst the skins, it will spill, and the skins will be ruined.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé néŋ melùʼ mesẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntúʼ yesẅé.
en: No, new wine is put into fresh wineskins.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le nú melùʼ mie é vfǒ tà é gwoon ncwò wé, á gíŋ ńtsɔ́ɔn lénú melùʼ mie mé nyé ńtsɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́. Ńtí nue à gɔɔn ngie melùʼ mie é vfǒ, zɔ̌ɔ mbòŋ.»
en: And no one, after drinking old wine, wants new, because he says, ‘The old is better.’ ”
